name: From Me to You: Postcard Making Workshop
description:
Unleash your creativity this Saturday at our Postcard Making Workshop!

Join us for a fun-filled session where you'll design and craft personalised postcards that capture your unique style. Whether you're a seasoned artist or a beginner, the MAP team will guide you through various techniques using vibrant colours, unique textures, and imaginative designs. Perfect for making heartfelt gifts or just enjoying a creative afternoon. All materials are provided—just bring your enthusiasm and a sprinkle of imagination. Let’s turn simple postcards into cherished memories!

This event is conceptualised under our exhibition Hello & Goodbye:Postcards from the Early 20th Century.

name: Up, Close and Centre: Krishna Reddy
description:
Co-curator Kuzhali Jaganathan will unpack stories— obvious and hidden— through a close reading of an artwork in this session of Up Close and Centre. 
MAP is proud to present our latest exhibition Rhyme Unbroken — Krishna Reddy as Artist and Perpetual Student. As one of the first Indian artists of his generation to practise internationally, Krishna Reddy went on to win acclaim both at home and abroad for his contributions to the world of modern art and his masterful technical innovations in intaglio printmaking.

In this drop-in session, discover his groundbreaking techniques, explore the evolution of his art, and gain personal insights into his influential work. Don’t miss this unique chance to engage with the exhibition on a more personal level.

There will be 2 sessions held: at 3:00 pm and 5:00 pm.

This event is conceptualised under our latest exhibition Rhyme Unbroken — Krishna Reddy as Artist and Perpetual Student
